Class StockManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • StockManager
  • public class StockManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manage the stock in a business. The stock is described by zero or more Products.
    Version:
    2019.10.8
    Author:
    Erik Cooke

    • Method Detail

      • addProduct

        public void addProduct​(Product item)
        Add a product to the list only if the product id is unique
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be added.

      • delivery

        public void delivery​(int id,
                     int amount)
        Receive a delivery of a particular product. Increase the quantity of the product by the given amount.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the product.
        amount - The amount to increase the quantity by.

      • findProduct

        public Product findProduct​(int id)
        Try to find a product in the stock with the given id.
        Returns:
        The identified product, or null if there is none with a matching ID.

      • findProduct

        public Product findProduct​(java.lang.String name)
        Try to find a product in the stock with the given name
        Parameters:
        name - string used to search for product
        Returns:
        The product that is found, or null if none match with name

      • numberInStock

        public int numberInStock​(int id)
        Locate a product with the given ID, and return how many of this item are in stock. If the ID does not match any product, return zero.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the product.
        Returns:
        The quantity of the given product in stock.

      • printProductDetails

        public void printProductDetails()
        Print details of all the products.

      • printStockBelow

        public void printStockBelow​(int below)
        Prints a list of all products with a stock level less than the passed in parameter
        Parameters:
        below - print stock that is less than this number
